learning_goal: Advanced fluency in technical Chinese communication for machine learning roles

activities.description: Learn 50-75 essential machine learning terms. Utilize AI flashcards or language learning apps for focused memorization. Focus on pronunciation and writing, not just translation.

Review basic grammar structures related to technical discussion including: expressing cause and effect, describing procedures, comparing and contrasting concepts, and using quantifiers and measures. Use online resources and grammar guides targeting technical discourse.

Listen to machine learning lectures or discussions in Chinese (look for recordings or podcasts of technical conferences, if available).  Pay attention to how vocabulary and grammar are used in context.
Keep a log of new vocabulary learned, and record areas for improvement.  Review recorded lectures and podcasts with focus on unknown vocabulary and grammar.

Role-play scenarios with a language partner (or AI assistant) simulating typical machine learning discussions. Discuss model performance, debugging strategies, and potential improvements. Use newly acquired vocabulary and grammar structure.
Read short technical articles or blog posts on machine learning in Chinese. Focus on understanding the main ideas, terminology and sentence structures, noting challenging sections for further study.
Practice active listening.  Pay close attention to how your conversation partners structure their arguments, the subtle use of emphasis, and the overall communication style.

Spend time in a Chinese-speaking environment (potentially through virtual or in-person exchanges). Listen to real-world discussions in your field to further increase understanding of how technical topics are presented.

Focus on expanding vocabulary related to specific algorithms, models, and datasets relevant to your work. Utilize online Chinese dictionaries and glossaries focusing on machine learning technicalities.
Write brief summaries or analyses of machine learning concepts or recent advancements in Chinese.  Compare your writing to native-speaker models for feedback.
Reflect on your progress, identifying your strengths and areas for further development.
Prepare and practice presenting a machine learning project or topic in Chinese.  Record your presentation and seek feedback from a language partner or AI assistant.
Practice debating machine learning topics or concepts.  Structure arguments and counter-arguments, using formal and informal Chinese communication strategies.

Review the concepts from the past weeks.  Apply the skills from previous weeks in a real-world context.  This could be by joining a discussion, presenting a project, or initiating a conversation with a native speaker.
Summarize your achievements.  Set realistic next steps for continued language development and technical communication.
